body_content.explanation: in rugby, the three players that are at the front of a scrum (= a group of players from each team who come together with their heads down and arms joined, and push against each other, trying to take control of the ball):
examples: The hooker, tighthead prop, and loosehead prop make up the front row in a scrum.
They were finding it hard to compete in the front row.

body_content.explanation: in rugby, one of the three players that are at the front of a scrum (= a group of players from each team who come together with their heads down and arms joined, and push against each other, trying to take control of the ball):
examples: The team already have some injury worries, with front-row Jones unlikely to start.
The French front-row forward has been sent off three times this season.
